segment.source: Learn how to programmatically create an **AdControl** using JavaScript.
segment.target: Learn how to programmatically create an **AdControl** using JavaScript.

segment.source: Create an AdControl in Javascript
segment.target: Create an AdControl in Javascript

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: This example shows how to programmatically create an AdControl using JavaScript.
segment.target: This example shows how to programmatically create an AdControl using JavaScript.

segment.source: HTML div for an AdControl
segment.target: HTML div for an AdControl

segment.source: An AdControl needs to have a div on the html page that will show the ad.
segment.target: An AdControl needs to have a div on the html page that will show the ad.

segment.source: The code below provides an example of such a div.
segment.target: The code below provides an example of such a div.

segment.source: JavaScript for creating an AdControl
segment.target: JavaScript for creating an AdControl

segment.source: The following example assumes that you are using an existing div in your HTML with the ID myAd.
segment.target: The following example assumes that you are using an existing div in your HTML with the ID myAd.

segment.source: Instantiate the AdControl in the app.onactivated function.
segment.target: Instantiate the AdControl in the app.onactivated function.

segment.source: The values are examples.
segment.target: The values are examples.

segment.source: In your code you will set the values of these functions and properties appropriate for your app.
segment.target: In your code you will set the values of these functions and properties appropriate for your app.

segment.source: If you use this code and do not see ads, you can try inserting an attribute of position:relative in the div that contains the AdControl.
segment.target: If you use this code and do not see ads, you can try inserting an attribute of position:relative in the div that contains the AdControl.

segment.source: This will override the default setting of the IFrame.
segment.target: This will override the default setting of the IFrame.

segment.source: Ads will be displayed correctly, unless they are not being shown due to the value of this attribute.
segment.target: Ads will be displayed correctly, unless they are not being shown due to the value of this attribute.

segment.source: Note that new ad units may not be available for up to 30 minutes.
segment.target: Note that new ad units may not be available for up to 30 minutes.
